website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive emergency light that is great to have handy.
pros: Great to keep handy for when the electricity goes out
They work similar to a child's glow stick but are brighter and rated to last for 12 hr

customer_reviews.title: Took these on a African Safari where I lived in tents for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Took these on a African Safari where I lived in tents for 2 weeks. I would light one each night at dark and they gave the tent a mice warm glow with just enough light so I could get around any time of night, still burning bright in the morning and still a slight glow 24 hrs later. They made the stay in the tent more convertible and they did not attract bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bore

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line chem-sticks
customer_reviews.text: These are top of the line light sticks. I used cases of the military version in the Army and these are the same thing made by the same company just the civilian version. The civilian version (SnapLight) is better then the military version (ChemLight) as the civilian version has all the latest composition and chemistry updates allowing for more brightness and shelf life longevity (5 year as compared to 4 for the ChemLights). This is because ChemLights are required to meet a DoD standard that locks them in to an older chemistry configuration. I keep them in my camping and emergency kits. If you like the review, click the Yes button below :)
customer_reviews.author: The Cheif

customer_reviews.title: There really is no replacement for Cyalume chem/glow sticks...
customer_reviews.text: There really is no replacement for Cyalume chem/glow sticks. Many other glow sticks work well, but don't have the brightness or the longevity of this brand. In context to other Cyalume glow sticks, these are not as bright as the green ones, but serves it's purpose well. I normally use green for general use (camping, backpacking, power outages, etc) and yellows more for a "warning" or "caution", as I did in this case. On a side note, orange or red does not create enough light unless it's really dark. I would highly recommend this particular band. That being said, yellow is not ideal if you're looking for brightness.
customer_reviews.author: ArnellTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Bright emergency chemical light good for about 12 hours.
customer_reviews.text: My experience has been that most of the 12 hour Cyalume products do exactly what they are advertised to do. I have used them for night SCUBA diving, cave and cavern exploration to include underwater, and in hazardous atmospheres as a primary light (non-flammable) and they produce light with almost no heat. Easy to initiate after removing the wrapper by simply cracking the vial inside the large vial and shaking. Disposal is also easy as the chemical reaction eventually dissipates and and all that has to be done is throw them in the garbage. Keep in mind that there is no "ON/OFF" switch. Once activated they will run their course to depletion.
customer_reviews.author: G in SC

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Item
customer_reviews.text: The yellow snap Glow Sticks last all night and are great for highlighting obstacles at night while camping (avoid stubbing one's toes on the way to the latrines), without wrecking everyone's night vision. (We use them when we go LARPing.) I would give them 5 stars if they were just a little less expensive. A quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: After receiving these, I did pop one open and lit it up, and was impressed with the brightness and the time it stayed lit (approx. 11 hours) although it was noticeably dimmer after about 6 hours. I put a large portion of these in my car emergency kit and have the rest sitting in strategic areas around the house in case of power outage. For the price, I think these are great emergency lights and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Randy RowellTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Out of date but still working great!
customer_reviews.text: Had power outage last night and used a couple of these. I have had them for approx. 3 years (could be 3.5). They were still going strong (I had read they only last a year). Also! After 12 hours, one of them was still very bright, and even now after 17 hours it has a tad of a glow! Good deal! (Not sure on the second one I used, as I didn't look at it; wish I had!) But did want to come on here and let ya'll know that these will hopefully work longer and better than they claim! Good news! I had the yellow, as I thought they would be brighter and do better with power outage.
customer_reviews.author: feemeister

customer_reviews.title: Fun at bath time
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these original Cyalume snap sticks for several years now and outside of the White colored ones, I have been pretty happy with them. People need to lower their expectations of what these are. They are ment to be markers/night lights. They are not ment to read book underneath. I started using them for bath time with my 2 year old. Drop a couple in the tub and turn off the lights...he LOVES it and it is just another sensory stimulation. Note to buyers of the 20 packs. They cime in a one gallon bag, not 2, ten count boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Steel

customer_reviews.title: Lasts all night but not as bright as I expected
customer_reviews.text: These are the same size as the original green cyalume sticks that we used to have 35 years ago, not the small 4 - 5" size that are more common today. These specific sticks are made of thicker plastic that will be quite durable - more than durable enough. The life of the stick at 68 - 75 degrees after snapped was about 8 hours. The only downside is that the sticks are not quite as bright as I was expecting. They were good, just not as bright as I thought that they would be.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Practical

customer_reviews.title: Great for power outage or keeping track of the kids at night
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for power outages and for the kids to use at Halloween. We have tried the green ones and the yellow. Yellow seems to give the brightest light. These usually last all night and into the next day before they loose their glow. I have purchased these multiple times now and have not been disappointed. I also like the fact that each individual stick is wrapped in its own sealed package.
customer_reviews.author: Jinxers

customer_reviews.title: Works well and pretty bright
customer_reviews.text: They work, They are bright enough. They claim 12 hours but the two I used lasted about 9 hours and then really started to lose their brightness fast. You could still see they were giving off light but not bright at all, you had to be almost on top of them to see them. This was outside so maybe they would be bright longer if you were inside. Still 9 hours is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Bensen

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: I keep these in my go bag with my Water, Compass, and Whistle. For the water and woods in emergencies, safety should always have been the start of the plan. Snow, Fog, Darkness, Getting Lost and Accidents happen very quickly. These are not your dollar store variety of snap lights they are far brighter and last far longer 12 hours + in my tests and work well for lighting and signaling at night. You will never be in the dark if you have a few of these in your go bag.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Fun fact...read here
customer_reviews.text: My father sold these to Japanese fishermen in the '60's. That's what they were for...they used them underwater! Any how, these bring back memories as my siblings and I were the first kids in the neighborhood to come outside at night with one of these things to throw around. Alas, now as an adult I have purchased these for blackout/backup emergency, they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: zenner

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: This was my third box of Cyalume light sticks... I previously bought two boxes of the green light sticks and they are crazy bright... These yellow lights are brighter than most but not as bright as the green ones... They do last all night though and if you need the yellow color for a specific reason these would be a great option.. I highly recommend the Cyalume lights, very good quality :-)
customer_reviews.author: StampedeSurvival

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed with this product.
customer_reviews.text: i read all the reviews that were on the ordering page. I was very dissapointed with the quality of these Snaplight sticks.I wanted to use them on Halloween for out door decoration and for children to help being seem. It was my grandson's first Halloween being big and old enough to go out doors. They did not glow as descripted in aid. I am very unhappy with this product. I could not find them in local stores in my area. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Newsom

customer_reviews.title: they might be good for parties (after being microwaved)
customer_reviews.text: They were not very bright at room temperature (69 degrees). I had been hoping to use the as emergency lights in my family car, but I tried using one in the 31 degree winter weather and it hardly lit up. They do become very, very bright if you microwave them for a short time (demo videos on YouTube) - bright enough to light a medium-size room. So, they might be good for parties (after being microwaved).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Night Diving approved
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use during night SCUBA diving to identify my team and they worked, were bright and lasted more than 12hrs! Product arrived on time, as described and in new condition. Would purchase again but I have swapped to reusable light options (glotoob) that are more ECO friendly and come in different colors (over time more cost effective too).
customer_reviews.author: B4Me

customer_reviews.title: Last a good while
customer_reviews.text: Although is says 12 hours it will loose it's brightness as expected but you can still see them at night. They are bright for a good long time to use as artificial light and when they start loosing their brightness they are still good for marking locations.
customer_reviews.author: Ed  H

customer_reviews.title: A Seriously Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Just one snap and they're easily bright enough to illuminate a large room with an unoffensive, soft, yellow glow. It lasted at least all night, so I put a few in my go-bag. They arrived on time, and each stick is individually wrapped in an inflated plastic/foil packaging to keep it from accidentally activating in a backpack. Pick up as many as you want while they're on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I used these inside pumpkin heads on Halloween and two days before when electricity went out.Was very disappointed it the light it put out.I thought military grade would be very bright.They were not . I used 3 in one head and still not very bright.They did glow for a long time though.But I could have got this quality for cheaper at the dollar store
customer_reviews.author: Banita Clayson

customer_reviews.title: good product, very bright
customer_reviews.text: good product, very bright. i purchased others from another seller and they lasted a little longer, but i like that these are individually wrapped. i will be placing in my care for emergencies!
customer_reviews.author: jeepgirlod

customer_reviews.title: nice to have piece of mind when i got these
customer_reviews.text: i bought this product for "just in case" emergencies. i put a few around the house just in case we have another brown out...we do have flashlights but it can be a pain to find out the batteries are almost dead, these last around 12 hours of so. i even put some in the cars just in case the care breaks down; nice to have piece of mind when i got these.
customer_reviews.author: Illinois' Villa

customer_reviews.title: Must have product !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for the money. Every house should have them for emergency, like a blackout. Also good to help children who are afraid of dark get over their fear. One lights up a room just enough to see your way around. Must have product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn't love Cyalume Snaplights
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance as always. Ive purchased these and other colors many times on here. We keep them in the cars, in the junk drawer, in our camping supplies, give them out at Halloween and just play with them during Nerf fights with all the lights off. Yellow and Green are the best for seeing by.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy and Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2/14 - good until 9/18
customer_reviews.text: Once you decide to buy Cyalume light sticks (which are the real deal), then there are only 2 questions: color and if the vendor is selling stock that is old or new. If you want brightness for reading in a power emergency, green or yellow will do. My vendor was Amazon, the price was excellent - 1 dollar a stick! - and the expiration data is over 4.5 years away. That means these haven't been sitting around a warehouse for a while. If Amazon is the online vendor, you can buy this Cyalume stick with confidence at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: The Rocketman

customer_reviews.title: So Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very good lights. We are real big into Halloween and use light sticks instead of candles for safety in our jack-o-lanterns and other decorations outside. It is difficult to find decent lights in the stores and have been disappointed the last couple of years about the appearance in our displays so I decided to try these instead. While they are more expensive they are worth it because of the brightness and longevity of light. I plan on ordering these every year from now on!
customer_reviews.author: BethArlington

customer_reviews.title: Great but not awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping these would be awesome. They're great but not awesome. My kids ended up with a random collection bag of glow sticks and there was some in the bag that were awesome and lasted all night and well into the next day still glowing the second day, but didn't have any markings. I was hoping these would be just as good. They glow bright, but only last through the night
customer_reviews.author: Mr.&Mrs. JAC

customer_reviews.title: I think they are a great emergency must have
customer_reviews.text: I have used these in the past during a power outage. I keep 2 in my glove box of the car for me, my wife and sons car. I think they are a great emergency must have.
customer_reviews.author: william j kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality very heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality very heavy duty. Exactly as advertised. We used this for making the rescue Kayaks more visible at night during a 54 mile swim. The Chem lights lasted the entire time as advertised. Units were used above and below water for up 12 hours. Easily attached for use by a small hole in the top of the light. This is now part of my everyday use, and will be in my back pack and home.
customer_reviews.author: William McHenry

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Snapped one for testing around 5pm.....7 am the next morning still going but not quite as strong. Stays pretty freaking bright for a good while. Glad to have them in my bag. Will test again at a later date just to make sure the expiration is truthful and product retains its brightness
customer_reviews.author: s. bass

customer_reviews.title: I have to give these 3 stars because I am ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to give these 3 stars because I am accustomed to the green $2.00 pack at Home Depot that are extremely bright so much longer. To me it is a get what you pay for thing I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: light stick, yellow (Pack of 10), Bought at Amazon
customer_reviews.text: These seem to arrive in a day, quick transaction, is as indicated in desript.. A++ These are 6"+, lrg enough to make inside the tent or small area viewable approx 10/12 hrs +/-. Persnly, yellow is my choice, but least sold. red light is less, that's why it's used in combat. yellow will serve you better, that's why green boards & yellow chalk are easier to view. I won't break one of these to tell abt the functioning. These will work. I'll buy more from same seller in the few weeks for the winter season. Buy the yellow. JW
customer_reviews.author: B+Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not very bright
customer_reviews.text: I used these for halloween and they're just not very bright. I hung the whole pack from the ceiling and it barely lit anything in the room. The room is also very small-NYC apartment. They were okay but I wouldn't get them again for this purpose. Might be fine for other things though.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The sticks themselves are no brighter than a dollar store glow stick. Dims to a pale glow after the first hour. Couple this with the fact that the order took over TWO WEEKS to arrive after being delayed twice with no communication from the seller. Such waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Packard

customer_reviews.title: Power outage and for car
customer_reviews.text: It came highly recommended for power outages and to keep in the car. I’m just a safety person so have these and other battery operated equipment.
customer_reviews.author: K Hayashida

customer_reviews.title: Good for marking and safely navigating close areas
customer_reviews.text: Bright enough to cast shadows in a small room. These are better for marking yourself than lighting up the environment, but you will be able to safely navigate a dark area with these. Don't expect to use these glow sticks like a lantern. I wanted to use them for a night game of paintball but they were so bright we decided to save them for another time. They will definitely give your position away in pitch dark. You could use them as subtle ambient lighting in pitch dark by placing or throwing them in a room so you don't walk into walls and furniture. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wardlaw

customer_reviews.title: They are great to have at all times
customer_reviews.text: They are great to have at all times. I used them around the house when the lights has gone out, two in my purse at all times. Everybody should carry these or keep them in their house because you never know when you might need some light and there is no flashlighe around. The price is not bad at all. They are so good to have if you get a flat tire at night or your car break down. You can use these Cyalume Snaplight for almost anything. Yes I plan to buy some more and I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sergent

customer_reviews.title: Light sticks: what else do you need to know?
customer_reviews.text: Chem Light sticks: what else do you need to know? Used to use them on search and rescue opps, now keep on hand for “lights out“ “Gee, Mr. Wilson, the power plant failed in the emergency and my ohmywhatare we going to do?!“ situations and for our bug out bags. Get some!
customer_reviews.author: nd2kos

customer_reviews.title: Bright Lights
customer_reviews.text: Nice Lights. Brighter than the ones you can get at most stores. Lasts 12 hours at full power, but up to 24 total even though it loses its brightness. No complaints, works to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Criniti, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Chemical light
customer_reviews.text: Get a box of two of these. They last a long time. They are idiot proof, unless your dog chews them up! I keep these around now with the summer heat, and the electricity going out. They help you get your candles and matches, keep the room lit so you do not stumble on the chairs and the corners of other furniture in the dark. They are great for kids to take with them camping. They are good on Halloween as an aid for everyone else to see your kids as they cross the streets. They have a lot of uses. These are good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Luis A. Bouza

customer_reviews.title: Bright!
customer_reviews.text: I have always worked with the green, but the yellow is brighter, even when held side by side. I get a solid 10 hours of use. By the 12th hour they mention its pretty dim, and it still puts out about 10-15% of its power for about 16 hours. Has a way to clip it to yourself, or hang it. Sturdy solid plastic. Great product, great shelf life. I want to say they say 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Adam T

customer_reviews.title: Well I'll be...  Glow sticks!
customer_reviews.text: These work as you'd expect. They're Cyalume brand, so they're the real thing. I keep a few for emergencies, but mainly it's for my son's baths. If you have kids, try a glow stick bubble bath. They love it. They aren't battery/nuclear powered. They're glow sticks. Why do people think they can crack one and signal planes or hang it from a tree and mow the lawn? It's a freaking glow stick people. It does exactly what normal people would expect from a glow stick.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's glow is not any better than a child's pack of glowsticks I got from Walmart. I cracked one of these and one of them at the same time and there was nothing special about these at all. I'm disappointed, I won't be buying again. I'm glad I gave it a try tho.
customer_reviews.author: Makayla West

customer_reviews.title: Work great for diving!
customer_reviews.text: We use these cyalumes when diving at night as a backup to a backup if something goes wrong or if we want to have a dance party underwater. They work!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Emergency Preparedness!
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of this product for emergency preparedness. After watching a demo video on Amazon, I was sold. They last for hours and it will be convenient to have them around the house whenever needed.
customer_reviews.author: Payne

customer_reviews.title: Helped get me through a 9 hour blackout. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Helped get me through a 9 hour blackout. I was able to read 1 few book chapters during a blackout with one of these.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Great to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: Good light, good run time. Shelf life seems to exceed what they print. Handy to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very impressed with the brightness and how long it sustained the brightness. I will buy more
customer_reviews.author: jka

customer_reviews.title: Yellow is the brightest
customer_reviews.text: Always nice to have in car, boat, garage, backpack. They have a uses where nothing else will work.
customer_reviews.author: Yeah, .... right

customer_reviews.title: long lasting and bright
customer_reviews.text: After frequent power outages these have been a perfect little extra. They put out enough light to get around the house in pitch black, but work equally well outside. Parties, fun with the kids, or even emergencies make these a great little stowaway item. life expectancy is around 8-12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice & bright
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly (used at Halloween), nice and bright. The yellow color would be better for reading than the ‘standard’ green or the other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Povey

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate for Outdoor Lighting Projects
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to light up some cutout decorations and some small hanging cloth ghosts for Halloween. They just simply don't give off enuf light for any of that. You'll have to use the usual plugged in lighting if you want your decorations to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: when I took it out of the Amazon box it looked like it was picked out of the garbage bin
customer_reviews.text: The box of the product itself (not the Amazon shipping box) was crushed, when I took it out of the Amazon box it looked like it was picked out of the garbage bin.
customer_reviews.author: J.Starfish

customer_reviews.title: Good emergency light
customer_reviews.text: I keep about 2 dozen of these (green and yellow) on hand for our frequent power outages and major storms. I tack a small finishing nail into the overhead door frames and tie one off. Lasts pretty well through the night. Cheaper than buying D cells. Not as bright as a flashlight but does give off more than enough light to see clearly
customer_reviews.author: sepp6424

customer_reviews.title: Great self life when not used. Durable bright, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great, durable and worth the money last for over 24 hours in cold weathers. Highly recommend this product. Self life over a year
customer_reviews.author: athena

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. It kept my Grand Kids safe during Halloween!
customer_reviews.author: William Gosz

customer_reviews.title: Good for jack-o-lantern
customer_reviews.text: These are good to light your jack-o-lantern, and just to have around
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Abbzugg XI

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size, Price and Quality
customer_reviews.text: These work really well in our organization emergency kits. The quality, value and compact size can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not just for rave parties
customer_reviews.text: Hurricane kit item! I put one in the refrigerator and another one in the freezer. I also put one in each bathroom. They last 12 hours! Great item to use when you want to conserve your batteries during hurricanes
customer_reviews.author: ABGM

customer_reviews.title: These are the best
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the chemlight brand and half the cost. Yellow is very easy to see and the kids love them. They come with a lanyard to fasten to anything you need
customer_reviews.author: Suburban Guy

customer_reviews.title: Light Bright
customer_reviews.text: Just received my light sticks last week and they arrived in a timely manner and the packaging was remarkable. Cracked one of these suckers to try and to my surprise it is bright and lasted almost 12 hours! I am satisfied with my purchase and I believe that these light sticks will provide me safe lighting in case of a power outage and/or hiking in my tent. Of course, you will need a flashlight as this light is supplemental, but it will safe greatly on batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Pugmom

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Used during hurricane Irma when the power went out. Good for leaving in a bathroom or dark room to find your way.
customer_reviews.author: Jarm

customer_reviews.title: Prepper Chem Light Stick
customer_reviews.text: I am sure all of you have seen or used one of these before. They may glow for a long period, but lighting up a room will only be for a relatively short period. I have found all of them to be about the same. I prefer the Cyalume brand since I never had a problem with them before... They even worked when outdated. The expiration date is along the long side crimp. I believe this batch was dated for 2017. Which is fine. These are a handy item and should be included in an emergency bag.
customer_reviews.author: The real review

customer_reviews.title: The green is brighter and cooler looking color in my ...
customer_reviews.text: The green is brighter and cooler looking color in my opinion but these do exactly what they are advertised to do so 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Good glow sticks
customer_reviews.text: Good product that works well and lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ADAM SCHUMACHER

customer_reviews.title: Bright
customer_reviews.text: Bright and lasts long. Lights up the whole room for about 10-12 hours
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: Not very bright
customer_reviews.text: This are not very bright compared to others and the brightness was inconsistent between sticks. Maybe they're old?
customer_reviews.author: Man vs Web

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: just ok- not as bright as I thought would be they do last for about 24 hours
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Great for low light situations!
customer_reviews.text: And they're fun, too! They work and they're bright. Cost more than cheapies, but they seem brighter to me. Not sure how long they last. Popped one to test it and it dissappered. I think it was taken on an in house "adventure " by the short people that live here. Planning on getting another box and putting it away with these for power outages, camping, nighttime visibility, and fun. Free shipping and they arrived amazingly fast!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous5

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency light.
customer_reviews.text: It glows once it is snapped. 12 hours. On the money.
customer_reviews.author: Frank F. Rodriguez III

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These are very bright and last at least 12 hours. I had some that expired a year ago and they still lasted about 18 hours. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Biff

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and underperforming
customer_reviews.text: Given the reviews and “industrial” description, I was expecting super bright glow sticks. These looked like the shoddy glow sticks you buy for children. I purchased these for an event and they flopped.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdra Harris Glover

customer_reviews.title: Nice dependable bright glow
customer_reviews.text: Bright glow ...great for no heat lighting. The yellow is brighter than the green.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: These night lights can come in very handy for emergency ...
customer_reviews.text: These night lights can come in very handy for emergency situations I'd imagine. Our household uses them to play at night sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: CBZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Glow Sticks!
customer_reviews.text: Great glow sticks that have been used for various purposes, i haven't timed the longevity of the glow, but they definitely put out bright, usable light for a long time. Lanyard hole is strong enough to resist breakage from the kids. My 2nd time purchasing the yellow sticks and will purchase again. Green and yellow put out the best light IMO.
customer_reviews.author: MikeI

customer_reviews.title: Best ones out there
customer_reviews.text: Really Brite. I will be buying more of different colors
customer_reviews.author: REH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Earthquake Emergency Kits
customer_reviews.text: The recent earthquake in Napa reminded me that I needed to put together an emergency kit. I like that several of them came in the box allowing me to keep some in my car, at the office, and in my apartment. Come on Mother Nature, give me what you got.. I'm ready to try these guys out. On a different note, I'm also plan on taking these with my on my next camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: SFUXGuy

customer_reviews.title: Prepared for disaster!
customer_reviews.text: We lost power for a week during Hurricane Florence and these were a lifesaver. They are now a permanent part of the hurricane kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great for the kids
customer_reviews.text: Great for My kids and their friends. They loved them!
customer_reviews.author: Syke

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: These are nice bright sticks. We hope to use them for night time fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ya never know...
customer_reviews.text: A couple boxes should be a staple in every home. Ya never know and along with other emergency supplies. It makes sense in these times
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Snaplight glow stick
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I felt the price was right but I think another reason is because the battery will no wear out! What I mean is there is no battery and who knows when I will use this device and if I got a battery operated one you can be rest assured it will not work when you need it because the battery is dead! Wouldn't you agree?
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Ramseyer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing. Did not work well for us. ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Did not work well for us. We used these in plastic pumpkins to light the pathway to a party and you couldn't see them at all. These may work well in a completely darkened room but not for any other purpose. Will look elsewhere for lights next year.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: These things are great.
customer_reviews.text: Just as described by Cyalume these sticks are affected by temperature. I snapped one at night in my house when it was like 84 degrees or so. The dang thing was super bright at first and then after about an hour and a half started to really dim down until it was almost unusable at about six hours. The total time this provided really helpful light was about three hours and that's really good in the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Larry K

customer_reviews.title: When you need long lasting light with no matches and no battery and no solar panel
customer_reviews.text: A must if you want non flame and no battery lighting. I go with white green and yellow I have orange and red for emergencies only Asian putting on the road or what not
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy tiger

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright product
customer_reviews.text: Great light output. Nice and bright even better than described.
customer_reviews.author: hank

customer_reviews.title: Great visibility (yellow and green)
customer_reviews.text: I bought green and yellow based on other reviews as being the most visible - which they are - Great visibility for lobster buoys. Now I am thinking of buying the other colors though just to be more stylish in my lobster hooping.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use the old ones when I cycle em ...
customer_reviews.text: I keep 2 of these on a chunk of para cord in my life jacket on commercial fishing vessels. They are placed back in their baggies and the cut foil is taped shut to minimize UV damage. Fun to use the old ones when I cycle em out.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin McMurray

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend loves them. Got them for emergency light for his long mountain biking sessions. They are actually very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Sh

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are bright,but they don't last as long as they should
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: These were very bright and worked great for the kids to carry around while camping and as a nightlight in the tent
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must!
customer_reviews.text: It was definitely much brighter than I thought it was going to be. I haven't used them all but cracked two of them and they worked beautifully and lasted all night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and lasts all night long.
customer_reviews.text: Used it the the first time for night time water skiing. Was bright enough to even read by it "in my opinion": plus it was still glowing bright in the morning. All of which are important to me as this could trail light or be rescue beacon for my back country snow skiing adventures. Was not planning on it being so bright. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GLOW STICKS
customer_reviews.text: Works Great! Camping trip hooked 1 on each tent. Bright and worked
customer_reviews.author: djginyc

customer_reviews.title: Looked good
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used them yet but solid glow sticks. I will revise when I use one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Big A

customer_reviews.title: They stay illuminated for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried testing two of them and they stay illuminated for a long time (20 hours or so)...I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Loodis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent emergency backup
customer_reviews.text: These are great for hurricanes... They do not generate heat like candles or gas lanterns. Put one in main hall, family room and bath. They are not designed so you can read "War and Peace" but will keep you from running into things and allow reading can labels. It is amazing how little light the human eye really needs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Good glow sticks
customer_reviews.text: Nice glow sticks, my kids like them. A little hard to snap.
customer_reviews.author: A. Libera

customer_reviews.title: Have not used
customer_reviews.text: My Cyalume SnapLight Industrial Grade Chemical Light Sticks are still in the package and have not been used. My plan is to keep them handy for when we lose power or otherwise have a need for temporary lighting. I anticipate they will work as advertised but at this juncture cannot "shed any light" on their quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: First thing I reach for when the power goes out
customer_reviews.text: I keep them in the "power outage" cabinet on top of all the flashlights and batteries and so forth. First thing I reach for when the power goes out. Safe and long term stable. Put one in the bathroom, one on the stairs, one for a nightlight for whoever needs one.
customer_reviews.author: Incident51

product_meta.title: Cyalume SnapLight Yellow Glow Sticks – 6 Inch Industrial Grade, Ultra Bright Light Sticks with 12 Hour Duration (Pack of 10) (9-08004)
product_meta.description: Size:10 PackThe Cyalume SnapLight brings light to dark places. A cornerstone of emergency preparedness, survivalist and general safety plans for decades, these heavy-duty light sticks aren’t some glow stick you pick up at a party store. SnapLight provides bright, reliable, 360 degree illumination for up to 12 hours. The green SnapLight is so bright it can be seen from up to a mile away – so you can rest assured knowing it will provide enough light for rooms, hallways, stairwells or your walk back to camp. SnapLight is waterproof, non-toxic and non-flammable. The light stick has a hook and gate top, for hanging, attaching or stringing the lights together. To activate SnapLight, simply bend, snap and shake to immediately flood your surrounding area with functional light. Each green SnapLight measures 6” long, 10 sticks per pack. Each light stick is individually foil-wrapped for protection from light and moisture and boasts a five-year shelf life from date of manufacture. For technical specifications, see the Material Safety Data Sheet below. The maker of SnapLight, Cyalume, is a pioneer and world leader in chemical lighting solutions for tactical and safety applications. Trusted by the US Military and government agencies for over 40 years, you can rest assured knowing that our products will perform when they are needed most – without question. All Cyalume products are expertly engineered and crafted in the USA to strict quality standards.
feature_bullets: MADE IN THE USA UNDER STRICT QUALITY GUIDELINES to ensure each light stick works without issue - . Rest assured knowing you can trust SnapLight.
PATENTED, LONG-LASTING FORMULATIONS provide high light output for up to 12 hours at a time to help you get the job done when electric light isn’t an option.
INDUSTRIAL-GRADE STICK CONSTRUCTION provides a level of durability not found in competitor light sticks. Our formulations have no equal.
WATER-PROOF, NON-FLAMMABLE, NON-TOXIC CHEMISTRY means SnapLight is as safe as it is durable. Perfect for confined spaces or underwater applications.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
